questions.text: Which of the following is not true about exudate?

options.label: A
options.text: High specific gravity (>1.020) due to high protein content

questions.text: A 65-year-old male with a history of hypertension and hypercholesterolemia presents to the emergency department with sudden-onset chest pain and shortness of breath. An electrocardiogram (ECG) shows ST-segment elevation in leads II, III, and aVF. Also his serum troponin levels are elevated. He has been diagnosed with myocardial infarction. Which of the following cells are central regulators of hemostasis?
Identify the commonest cause of primary hypercoagulability amongst the following?

options.label: B
options.text: Factor V mutation (called the Leiden mutation)

questions.correct_answer: B. Factor V mutation (called the Leiden mutation)
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Factor V mutation (called the Leiden mutation)

questions.text: A 35-year-old female presents to the clinic with a history of recurrent miscarriages and multiple episodes of deep vein thrombosis. Laboratory tests reveal the presence of lupus anticoagulant and anticardiolipin antibodies. Which of the following best characterizes the condition in this patient?
Which of the following is the fate of thrombus? Propagation Embolization Dissolution Organization and recanalization

Dr Sparsh was experimenting in his laboratory on hemostasis. He found that a molecule “X” which was responsible for platelet activation using G protein coupled receptor called protease activated receptor 1. Identify “X” in the given scenario:

A 35-year-old pregnant woman at 38 weeks gestation is admitted to the labor and delivery unit in active labor. During labor, she suddenly becomes unresponsive and goes into cardiac arrest. Cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) is initiated immediately. Despite aggressive resuscitative efforts, the patient does not respond, and unfortunately, she passes away. Autopsy findings reveal the presence of squamous cells, vernix caseosa, and fetal debris within the pulmonary vasculature. Which of the following best explains the underlying pathophysiology of this patient's condition?

A 71-year-old male with a history of poorly controlled hypertension due to him being non compliant with medications is brought to the emergency room by his family because of increasing shortness of breath. An X-ray of the chest reveals bilateral pleural effusions and enlargement of the heart. Given these features, of the following, which is the most likely causative mechanism for the condition producing his shortness of breath?
Which of the following is not a feature of shock in a patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Increased lipids in adrenal cortical cells

questions.correct_answer: C. Increased lipids in adrenal cortical cells
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Increased lipids in adrenal cortical cells

questions.text: An elderly patient was admitted in the ICU of a hospital for last 10 days. He complained of respiratory distress and collapsed in 15 minutes. On autopsy, his lungs had an appearance as shown. Which of the following is not true about his condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Most cases have the venous emboli originating from the deep leg veins

options.label: C
options.text: Sudden death may occur due to left ventricular failure

options.label: D
options.text: Embolic obstruction of the vessels may lead to pulmonary hypertension

questions.correct_answer: C. Sudden death may occur due to left ventricular failure
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Sudden death may occur due to left ventricular failure

questions.text: Pick the correct option describing the correct statements about venous thrombosis Affects coronary, cerebral and femoral arteries Lines of Zahn are absent Progress in anterograde manner from point of attachment Stasis more important in pathogenesis in comparison to endothelial damage
Arrange the following steps of platelet changes in the correct sequence during hemostasis:

A 55-year-old female presents to the clinic with complaints of persistent swelling in her right arm following a radical mastectomy for breast cancer. The surgery was performed six months ago, and the patient has been undergoing adjuvant therapy since then. Physical examination reveals significant edema and thickening of the right arm, and the skin over the affected area appears erythematous and indurated. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the patient's arm swelling?

A 55-year-old male Harish Kumar with a history of atrial fibrillation presents to the emergency department with acute-onset left leg pain and swelling. The patient has been non-compliant with anticoagulant therapy for the past few weeks. On physical examination, the left lower extremity appears erythematous and edematous, with palpable cords along the superficial veins. Duplex ultrasonography confirms the presence of a thrombus in the left popliteal vein. Which of the following best represents the components of Virchow triad that contribute to the development of the patient's condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Endothelial injury, platelet aggregation and venous stasis

options.label: B
options.text: Endothelial injury, hypercoagulability, and arterial spasm

options.label: C
options.text: Hypercoagulability, venous stasis, and endothelial injury

options.label: D
options.text: Platelet aggregation, arterial spasm, and hypercoagulability

questions.correct_answer: C. Hypercoagulability, venous stasis, and endothelial injury
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Hypercoagulability, venous stasis, and endothelial injury

questions.text: Which of the following is the protein is involved in the development of arterial and venous thrombosis in patient with elevated levels of homocysteine?

A young female Basanti presents with recurrent thromboses, repeated miscarriages, cardiac valve vegetations, and thrombocytopenia. Laboratory tests reveal the presence of lupus anticoagulant and anticardiolipin antibodies in the blood. Which of the following is the most plausible explanation for her recurrent fetal loss?

options.label: A
options.text: Antibody mediated thrombocytopenia leading to excessive bleeding

options.label: B
options.text: Antibody mediated thrombosis of placental vessels

options.label: C
options.text: Antibody mediated interference with differentiation of trophoblasts

questions.correct_answer: C. Antibody mediated interference with differentiation of trophoblasts
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Antibody mediated interference with differentiation of trophoblasts

questions.text: A 45-year-old male with a history of congestive heart failure presents with abdominal pain, ascites, and lower extremity edema. Laboratory tests reveal elevated liver enzymes and bilirubin. Imaging studies show hepatomegaly with a mottled appearance on the liver surface. Liver biopsy demonstrates centrilobular congestion, hemorrhage, and fibrosis. Which of the following best describes the most likely cause of the liver findings in this patient?

A 25-year-old male undergoes a central venous catheter insertion for intravenous access during a surgical procedure. Shortly after the catheter insertion, the patient develops sudden-onset dyspnea, tachycardia, and hypotension. Physical examination reveals decreased breath sounds on the left side of the chest. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the patient's symptoms?
Identify the best answer for the increased blood volume within tissues due to congestion:

options.label: B
options.text: Active process due to arteriolar dilation

options.label: C
options.text: Affected area in the tissue turns red

questions.text: Pick the correct option describing the correct statements about white infarct: Seen in organs with end arterial circulation Affects lungs and small intestine commonly Well defined margins are seen Edema is absent
